title: Business confidence in Massachusetts drops again, report says
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Business confidence in Massachusetts declined in October due to rising prices, federal disruptions, and tariff uncertainties.
The AIM Business Confidence Index, a survey of over 140 employers, reported its longest pessimism streak since 2020.
Federal shutdown and policy changes hinder economic analysis, impacting state productivity and labor market dynamics.

title: Boston Legacy FC announce date of 2026 home opener
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Boston Legacy FC will debut in the NWSL at Gillette Stadium on March 14, 2026, against a yet-to-be-announced opponent.
The expansion team will play its inaugural season in Foxborough while White Stadium in Boston undergoes renovations.
Legacy FC has signed nine players so far and must double this to meet the league's minimum roster size for games.

title: Six straight wins later — are the Patriots officially back?
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: The New England Patriots, under new head coach Mike Vrabel, have achieved a six-game win streak led by rookie QB Drake Maye.
Standout performances from Stefon Diggs, Rhamondre Stevenson, and DeMario Douglas have contributed to the Patriots' current season resurgence.
With a 7-2 record entering Week 10, Drake Maye's performance has sparked MVP discussions despite early-season doubts.

title: New UMass poll shows Markey with firm lead over Moulton
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: UMass Amherst/WCVB poll shows Sen. Ed Markey leading with 51% over Rep. Seth Moulton's 28% in the Democratic primary.
If Rep. Ayanna Pressley enters the race, Markey leads with 35%, followed by Moulton at 25% and Pressley at 21%.
Poll indicates voter awareness issues; Markey described as 'old' and Moulton as 'unknown' by respondents.

title: Mass. man missing after leaving hospital early Friday morning
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Leonard Mercury, 57, is missing after leaving Heywood Hospital in Gardner, Massachusetts around 2 a.m. Friday.
Mercury was last seen heading towards a nearby bike path in hospital clothing without shoes.
Police urge anyone with information to contact 911 or Gardner police at 978-632-5600.

title: ‘We’re feeling that first-snow magic’: New England ski resorts delight in the season’s first snow
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: New England ski resorts welcomed the first snow of the season over the weekend, exciting officials and visitors.
Bretton Woods in New Hampshire opens Nov. 28; Jay Peak in Vermont also saw early snowflakes, opening Nov. 28.
Snowmaking has started at several resorts including Stowe Mountain Resort and Killington, preparing for the upcoming season.

title: 5 new restaurants we’re excited to try in November
author: Jillian Dara
bullets: All’Antico Vinaio, a famous Florentine sandwich shop, opens in Boston's Back Bay offering Tuscan-styled sandwiches.
Capricho Colombian Steakhouse debuts in Brookline, showcasing Colombian flavors with dishes like filet mignon and sirloin cuts.
Twisted Fate Brewing opens its second taproom in Revere, featuring New England Hazy IPAs and an onsite restaurant.

title: Former Gov. Charlie Baker’s father dies at 97
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Charles D. Baker III, father of former Gov. Charlie Baker, died at 97 in Needham on Saturday.
He served as president of Harbridge House and held notable positions in the U.S. Department of Transportation.
The elder Baker taught at Northeastern University and was a trusted adviser to his son, especially during the pandemic.

title: Falcons accused Patriots of illegal simulation of a snap on crucial fourth quarter play
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Falcons accuse Patriots of simulating a snap with illegal clapping in 24-23 game victory.
The alleged simulation led to an intentional grounding penalty hindering Falcons' late-game strategy.
Patriots head coach Mike Vrabel dismissed the clapping claims, attributing noise to fan energy.

title: A Worcester woman has been missing since leaving work Friday morning
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Joanna Brown, 30, has been missing from Worcester since leaving the Bean Counter Bakery Cafe on Friday morning.
Police believe Brown may be in the Holyoke or Springfield area driving a 2025 Gray Mitsubishi Outlander, license plate 5GPN93.
Public urged to contact Worcester Police at 508-799-8606 or call 911 with any information about Brown's whereabouts.
